While I haven't particularly worried that I would get sick, the truth is, most of the patients I have spoken to felt the same. They believed the pandemic was real. Without a doubt. But, they just didn‚Äôt think it would happen to them. (6/11)

@FDA vaccine advisors vote in favor of @moderna_tx‚Äôs Covid-19 vaccine ‚Äì saying that it is to be used for people 18 years and older. We‚Äôre one step closer to having more vaccine. Amazing news, but this won‚Äôt be a silver bullet. Remember to #wearamask and #bekind

@moderna_tx 's vaccine appears very effective in preventing severe disease. See this graph: the blue line - the rate of cases of #Covid19 in people on placebo, the red line: those on vaccine. Both @FDA and Moderna say 94.5% efficacy is reached at least 14 days after the 2nd dose. https://t.co/CcOvk4jALo

Today the @FDA‚Äôs vaccine advisory committee is meeting again:this time to consider @moderna_tx‚Äôs #vaccine. By the end of the day, the US could be on their way to authorizing a 2nd vaccine. It can‚Äôt come soon enough. #Covid19 kills more than 2 ppl, on avg, in the US every minute.

And finally, ‚ÄúDid Moderna really create a vaccine in just two days?‚Äù Yes and no. The mRNA platform Moderna uses for its vaccine was developed over many years. But the design for the Covid-19 vaccine was done just in two days. (14/16) https://t.co/T71KR9o3wI

The idea behind a vaccine is it should stage a stronger (and maybe longer) immune response than your body has after a natural infection. We still don‚Äôt know how long ‚Äúnatural immunity‚Äù from a Covid-19 infection might last. (13/16)
‚ÄúWill I need to get the vaccine if I‚Äôve already had Covid-19?‚Äù The answer: probably. (12/16)
